I engage in a frontal way the whole question about meaning and
technique my fundamental idea is that the two can't fully and ultimately be
separated that it's only through the acquisition of technique that you can
express what is Meaningful and it is only through the meaning that is
expressed by the technique that something really becomes a work of art and is is worthy of your consideration
you can have masters of technique who write exercises like for the piano
they're not works of art they're exercises you have to know technique and they're a good way of learning technique
but through technique alone to the extent that it even exists so can be found alone uh there isn't any or me or
much meaning there may be limiting cases I don't care the the uh the point is still
the same that uh technique is in itself doesn't provide meaning it's only
technique in its conjunction with meaningfulness that you get a work of
art and in the history of uh film
